net.rem.regression.em

Class ExchangedParameter

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.rem.regression.em.ExchangedParameter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class ExchangedParameter
extends java.lang.Object
implements net.hudup.core.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable
    This class represents the exchanged parameter for the REM algorithm.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • logger

        protected static final org.apache.log4j.Logger logger
        Logger of this class.

      • alpha

        protected java.util.List<java.lang.Double> alpha
        Alpha coefficients for Z statistics.

      • betas

        protected java.util.List<double[]> betas
        Beta coefficients for X statistics as matrix. Each row of the matrix a a list of two beta coefficients for a regressor. As a convent, regression 1 also has a list of two beta coefficients.

      • coeff

        protected double coeff
        Probability associated with this component.

      • zVariance

        protected double zVariance
        Variance associated with this component.

                          java.util.List<double[]> betas)
        Constructor with specified alpha and betas.
        Parameters:
        alpha - specified alpha. It must be not null.
        betas - specified betas. It must be not null.

        Parameters:
        alpha - specified alpha. It must be not null.
        betas - specified betas. It must be not null.
        coeff - specified coefficient.
        zVariance - specified Z variance.

      • estimateZMean

        public double estimateZMean(java.util.List<double[]> xData)

        Returns:
        estimated mean.

      • terminatedCondition

        public boolean terminatedCondition(double threshold,
                                   ExchangedParameter currentParameter,
                                   ExchangedParameter previousParameter)
        Testing the terminated condition between this parameter (estimated parameter) and other parameter (current parameter). Only internal alpha coefficients and beta coefficients are tested.
        Parameters:
        threshold - specified threshold
        currentParameter - other specified parameter (current parameter).
        previousParameter - previous parameter is used to avoid skip-steps in optimization for too acute function. It also solve the over-fitting problem. Please pay attention to it.
        Returns:
        true if the terminated condition is satisfied.

      • alphaEquals

        public boolean alphaEquals(ExchangedParameter other)
        Testing whether the alpha coefficient of other parameter equals the alpha coefficient of other parameter.
        Parameters:
        other - other parameter.
        Returns:
        true the alpha coefficient of other parameter equals the alpha coefficient of other parameter.

      • isNullAlpha

        public boolean isNullAlpha()
        Testing whether all alpha coefficients are zero.
        Returns:
        true if all alpha coefficients are zero.

      • normalPDF

        public static double normalPDF(double value,
                               double mean,
                               double variance)
        Evaluating the normal probability density function with specified mean and variance. Inherited class can re-defined this density function.
        Parameters:
        value - specified response value z.
        mean - specified mean.
        variance - specified variance.
        Returns:
        value evaluated from the normal probability density function.

      • normalZCondProbs

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Double> normalZCondProbs(java.util.List<ExchangedParameter> parameterList,
                                                                java.util.List<double[]> xData,
                                                                java.util.List<double[]> zData)
        Calculating the normal condition probabilities of the specified parameters given regressor values (X) and response value Z. Inherited class can re-define this method. In current version, only normal probability density function is used.
        Parameters:
        parameterList - list of specified parameters.
        xData - given regressor values (X).
        zData - response values (Z).
        Returns:
        condition probabilities of the specified parameters given regressor values (X) and response value Z.

      • normalZCondProbs

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Double> normalZCondProbs(java.util.List<ExchangedParameter> parameterList,
                                                                double[] xVector,
                                                                double[] zVector)
        Calculating the normal condition probabilities of the specified parameters given regressor values (X) and response value Z.
        Parameters:
        parameterList - list of specified parameters.
        xVector - given regressor values (X).
        zVector - response values (Z).
        Returns:
        condition probabilities of the specified parameters given regressor values (X) and response value Z.

      • normalZPDF

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Double> normalZPDF(java.util.List<ExchangedParameter> parameterList,
                                                          java.util.List<double[]> xData,
                                                          java.util.List<double[]> zData,
                                                          double vicinity)
        Calculating the normal probabilities of the specified parameters given regressor values (X) and response value Z.
        Parameters:
        parameterList - list of specified parameters.
        xData - given regressor values (X).
        zData - response values (Z).
        vicinity - this parameter is depreciated.
        Returns:
        condition probabilities of the specified parameters given regressor values (X) and response value Z.
